title.narrative: Adapt to Climate change in Coastal Zones Vanuatu

description.narrative: Adapt. to CC in Coastal Zones Vanuatu

title.narrative: Adaptation to Climate Change in the Coastal Zone in Vanuatu

description.narrative: The overarching goal of V-CAP is to increase resilience of island communities to future climate change induced risks such as declining coastal and marine resources, intensifying climatic hazards and lack of awareness. The overall objective of the project is to improve the resilience of the coastal zone and its communities to the impacts of climate change in order to sustain livelihoods, food production and preserve and improve the quality of life in targeted vulnerable areas.
capital of a political entity

1. Number of vulnerable communities/villages/areas with enhanced resilience to climate change through effective planning and action for climate change 2. Percentage of the population in target sites covered by effective the 24/7 early warning system 3. Number of Policies in place to support Climate change adaptation and DRM enabling policies and supportive institutions in place

title.narrative: Mainstreaming global environmental priorities into national policies and programmes.

title.narrative: Vanuatu Low Emissions Capacity Building Phase II

description.narrative: The Vanuatu parliament ratified the Paris agreement on 18th June 2016. The Vanuatu NDC project is part of the major commitments towards UNFCCC under the Low Emission Capacity Building (LECB) Programme phase II.

The project aims to assist Vanuatu to strengthen and harmonize the policies, institutional frameworks and national MRV systems to mainstream national mitigation policies and targets in the context of Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs).
capital of a political entity

activity-description.narrative: Carrying-out stakeholder consultations to identify, develop and facilitate a holistic approach for developing the NDC implementation road map and implementation plan.

description.narrative: first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Detailed feasibility studies completed for micro-grid at Wintua village community located in South West Bay on Malekula and grid extensions for East Ambae (from Lolowai to St. Patricks College) and Maweo (Nasawa to Vonda)

description.narrative: 1. Attendance of key national stakeholders at COP 23. 2. % of completion on the Development of NDC implementation plans and institutional frameworks and extent of establishment of MRV systems to support NDC implementation. 3. % of completion of detailed techno-economic feasibility assessments and small-scale mitigation initiatives (solar street lighting & biogas) and NAMA feasibility studies.

comment.narrative: 1. At least two key Government representatives. 2. 10% 3. 50%

description.narrative: Vanuatu Third National communication and Biennial Update the the UNFCCC
The project objective is to support the Government of Vanuatu to prepare its Third National Communication (TNC) and First Biennial Report under the UNFCCC (FBUR).
capital of a political entity

activity-description.narrative: Support Govt of Vanuatu to prepare its 3rd TNC FBUR.

description.narrative:
1. Chapter of TNCâ€™s National Circumstances in accordance with guidelines as contained in decision 17/CP.8. 2. Chapter of TNC's Green House Gas Inventory (GHGI). 3. Chapter on Vulnerability Study and Measures to Facilitate Adequate Adaptation to Climate Change. 4. Chapter on Assessment of sectors, actions and projects that could be included in the national emission reduction strategy (mitigation). 5. Chapter on Domestic Measurement Reporting and Verification. 6. Chapter on Constraints and Gaps and Related Financial, Technical and Capacity Needs. 7. Chapter on Other information that are relevant to Vanuatu's TNC and BUR. 8. Vanuatu's TNC and BUR document.
[Scale = 1. Very little progress made; 2. Thematic Working Groups (TWGs) established; 3. Training workshops provided to TWGs; 4. Technical assessments conducted; 5. Chapters drafted; 6. Chapters finalized and submitted as part of TNC document]
